summary: This is a superseding indictment filed in the Southern District of New York against Ghislaine Maxwell. It charges her with six counts related to the sexual exploitation of minors, including conspiracy to entice minors to travel for illegal sex acts, enticement, transportation of a minor, and perjury. The document details her alleged role in recruiting, grooming, and facilitating the abuse of multiple minor victims by Jeffrey Epstein between approximately 1994 and 1997, and her subsequent false statements under oath in 2016.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Charged with conspiracy, enticement, transportation of minors, and perjury for her alleged role in facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's sexual abuse of minor girls.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as the primary abuser of minor victims, with Maxwell allegedly assisting in recruiting, grooming, and facilitating access to these victims.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Signed the superseding indictment as the Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

connections.description: Alleged co-conspirators in a scheme to entice and transport minors for illegal sexual activity. Had a personal and professional relationship; Maxwell was paid to manage Epstein's properties and was in an intimate relationship with him during the relevant period.
Maxwell allegedly facilitated Epstein's access to minor victims, groomed them, and was present for and participated in sexual abuse.

events.title: Period of Alleged Conspiracy and Abuse
events.description: Maxwell and Epstein allegedly conspired to entice and transport minor victims across state lines and internationally for the purpose of sexual abuse.

events.title: Minor Victim-1 Travel from Florida to New York
events.description: Minor Victim-1 was enticed to travel from Florida to New York to be sexually abused at Epstein's New York residence.

events.title: Massage of Minor Victim-2 in New Mexico
events.description: Maxwell provided an unsolicited, topless massage to Minor Victim-2 at Epstein's New Mexico residence as part of grooming.

events.title: First Perjurious Deposition Testimony
events.description: During a civil deposition, Maxwell falsely testified she was unaware of any scheme by Epstein to recruit underage girls for sexual massages and claimed limited knowledge of interacting with minors.

events.title: Second Perjurious Deposition Testimony
events.description: During a civil deposition, Maxwell falsely denied knowledge of sex toys at Epstein's home, denied giving massages, and falsely limited her knowledge of Epstein's sexual activities with others.

locations: Upper East Side, Manhattan, New York (Epstein's New York Residence)
Palm Beach, Florida (Epstein's Palm Beach Residence)
Santa Fe, New Mexico (Epstein's New Mexico Ranch)
Southern District of New York (jurisdiction for the indictment)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell is charged with six criminal counts, including conspiracy, enticement, transportation of a minor, and two counts of perjury.

The indictment alleges Maxwell played a central role in recruiting, grooming, and facilitating the sexual abuse of at least three minor victims (identified as Minor Victim-1, -2, and -3) by Jeffrey Epstein from approximately 1994 to 1997.
Victims were as young as 14 years old, and abuse occurred at multiple Epstein properties in New York, Florida, New Mexico, and at Maxwell's London home.

Maxwell is accused of repeatedly lying under oath during 2016 depositions in civil litigation, specifically denying knowledge of Epstein's scheme, her own involvement in massages, and Epstein's sexual activities with others.
The document is a superseding indictment (S1 20 Cr. 330), indicating it replaces a prior indictment with additional or revised charges.
